023
024package org.opt4j.benchmarks.zdt;
025
026import java.util.Random;
027
028import org.opt4j.benchmarks.BinaryString;
029import org.opt4j.benchmarks.N;
030import org.opt4j.core.common.random.Rand;
031import org.opt4j.core.problem.Creator;
032
033import com.google.inject.Inject;
034
035/**
036 * The {@link ZDT5BinaryCreator} for the ZDT5 problem.
037 * 
038 * @author lukasiewycz
039 * 
040 */
041public class ZDT5BinaryCreator implements Creator<BinaryString> {
042
043        protected final Random random;
044
045        protected final int length;
046
047        /**
048         * Constructs a {@link ZDT5BinaryCreator}.
049         * 
050         * @param random
051         *            the random number generator
052         * @param n
053         *            the n value
054         */
055        @Inject
056        public ZDT5BinaryCreator(Rand random, @N int n) {
057                super();
058                this.random = random;
059
060                length = ((n > 0) ? 30 : 0) + (n - 1) * 5;
061        }
062
063        /*
064         * (non-Javadoc)
065         * 
066         * @see org.opt4j.core.problem.Creator#create()
067         */
068        @Override
069        public BinaryString create() {
070                BinaryString string = new BinaryString();
071                string.init(random, length);
072                return string;
073        }
074
075}
